description.narrative: The project will target both large-scale and small-scale renewable energy. The project will adopt a comprehensive strategy to identify, assess and mitigate investment risks, creating attractive conditions for private sector investment and market growth.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

comment.narrative: 1. Development of methodological support for holding auctions for renewable energy in Kazakhstan. 2. Analysis of past renewable energy sources auctions 3. Modeling the implementation of renewable energy technology for managing electrical load (DEMAND RESPONSE) to balance the energy system of Kazakhstan including the use of energy storage devices 4. Analysis of legal assessment and methodological analysis for developing a national testing system related to quality control of renewable energy technologies (the need for institutional and organizational structures to monitor quality standards) 5. Analysis of the potential of renewable energy technologies in agriculture and rural areas 6. Analysis of possible implementation of various renewable energy technologies (for heat supply, cooling, and hot water supply) in various geographic zones, taking into account the resource potential 7. Economic analysis and development of a financial support scheme under the law on net consumers for development of a new financial product - for financing net consumers

1. Support in improving the procedures for conducting renewable energy auctions: analysis of existing (prepared) WPP/ SPP sites: a detailed list and an information and analytical report 2. Development of an Internet application for renewable energy – Content for the WEB version of the site (electronic library / interactive map of renewable energy projects) 3. Preparation of pilot sites (search and selection of projects that meet the requirements): preparation of a SPP project for conducting project auctions 4. Preparation of draft regulatory documents on improving mechanisms for supporting and encouraging small-scale RES projects 5. Develop appropriate business and financial models for the development of small-scale renewable energy sources for existing markets in Kazakhstan.

1. The project proposed to the Ministry of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan new type of RE auction, so called project auction (auction with pre-prepared documentation). This type of auction provides beforehand information to investors on a specific project implementation site, connection points, technical conditions for its connection to the power system, as well as data on the main parameters of the project in the package of pre-project documentation, including an integrated assessment of costs of construction of a renewable energy plant / calculation of commercial effectiveness of the project. The auction for this pilot SPP project was held on November 27, 2019, and aroused great interest from investors. This practice proved its viability and was recommended by the Ministry of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan, for further replication 2.The web portal module for renewable energy sources was developed (electronic library / interactive map of renewable energy stations, with the possibility of making changes): - Module - Cartographic section - Module - Financial Section - Module - Digital Library - Module - Q & A The developed module of the web portal was transferred to the balance of “Financial Settlement Center of Renewable Energy” LLP, for further use and operation 3. Prepared analysis of existing wind and solar sites, with detailed representation of the following parameters: Technical parameters for selecting wind and solar sites: (1) Capacity of wind/solar project in the range of 35-50 MW; (2) Geographical location of sites (Northern and Southern zone of Kazakhstan) (3) Confirmed average annual wind speed for wind sites is not lower than 7.5 m/s at a measurement height of 80-100 meters, and data availability is not lower than 95%; (4) Availability of a power distribution scheme and its agreeing with the network operator; Organizational and administrative parameters: (1) Availability of a dedicated land plot,(2) Availability of title documents for land slot(s) with the intended purpose for construction of wind/solar plants; (3) Availability of an archaeological report on the site for wind/solar plant; (4) Availability of a sanitary-epidemiological report on the site for wind/solar plant. 4. Developed and prepared recommendations to the Ministry of Energy on improving the coordination system, issuing permits and connecting small-scale renewable energy projects to networks, as well as mechanisms and support measures for grid and off-grid small-scale renewable energy projects. Also, legislative amendments were prepared, including: (1) Amendments to the Law on Renewable Energy Support, (2) Rules for connecting small projects to the electric network, (3) Rules for providing targeted government subsidies for project implementation. 5. To test the financial business model of stimulating deployment of small-scale renewable energy projects, the project presented to the National Partner - the Ministry of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan a concept that has been approved for implementation. Framework documentation was prepared for signing and testing financial schemes and mechanisms for deployment of small-scale RES projects by the business sector.

1. Development of a design scheme for land lots registration according to the simplified procedure and / or registration of the lots for a special company (SPV, for example registration for the SEC)/ Recommendations on indexing the tariff for the period of construction of a renewable energy facility 2. Certification of renewable energy auctions on information security 3. Preparation of an analysis / model on the basis of a distribution network for integration of small-scale renewable energy projects (in terms of power generation) with the obligatory calculation of economic and social indicators, including reduced fuel consumption, reduced maintenance costs and CO2 emissions 4. Calculation of the potential for using renewable energy for the needs of hot water supply and heating at various civil engineering facilities for domestic needs, taking into account gender aspects. 5. Development of a methodology for designing MRV system including small projects in the country reporting system and, in the future, for inclusion in the emission trading system 6. Development of an online calculator for various small-scale renewable energy technologies for use by all interested parties, including housewives 7. Implementation and testing financial support mechanisms for SMEs through Damu Foundation for application of renewable energy technologies.

1. The task was slightly modified at the early beginning of the year into research on energy subsidy, including recommendation on RE tariff. It was planned to hire a local subcontractor to conduct the research, but after unsuccessful attempt, in June and August 2020. Procurement process was renewed in new modality in September 2020, the evaluation process planned to be finalized till the end of the year and the task planned to be done till April 2021.
2. The analysis and preparation for the transition of KOREM JSC, an online platform for renewable energy auctions, to certification in information security and obtaining an ISO / IEC 27001: 2013 certificate were carried out: - A survey of the current state of information security of KOREM JSC was carried out in order to identify all information security management processes; relevance, compliance, and sufficiency of the standard requirements was assessed. - Analysis of information security risks of the web platform for holding RES auctions was done - Procedures for assessing information security risks of the web platform for holding RES auctions were developed - Implementation of information security management system processes was implemented
3. The modeling of the electrical distribution network on the integration of low-power renewable energy facilities (rooftop installations, low-power wind stations) was carried out on the example of the Turkestan region. In general, the modeling showed a positive effect from the integration of renewable energy facilities into the network, in terms of the reliability of power supply, reducing the load at overloaded network nodes, reducing losses for the transmission of electrical energy: - Review of the resource potential of renewable energy in the specified area by type of generation (wind, solar). - Assessment of the implementation of distributed generation by small-scale renewable energy sources. - Feasibility study for the implementation of distributed generation by small-scale renewable energy sources.
4. An analysis and comparison of two renewable energy technologies for hot water supply and heating in comparison with mostl available traditional heat sources, including centralized networks, for typical buildings in different cities of Kazakhstan, was carried out. - RES potential for heating and hot water supply in Kazakhstan - Analysis and calculation of the use of renewable energy sources and other sources (coal, gas, electric and other types of fuel) for the needs of heating and hot water supply in buildings, including administrative buildings - Barriers preventing the use of renewable energy sources for heating and hot water supply in Kazakhstan are formulated
5. Appropriate methodologies for the implementation of the MRV system for small-scale RES projects have been developed, including a programmatic approach. Methodologies were submitted to the Ministry of Ecology, Geology and Natural Resources of the Republic of Kazakhstan: - Generation of electricity from grid-connected solar photovoltaic, hydro, and wind power plants - Generation of solar photovoltaic, hydro, and wind energy: as an autonomous source and in a mini-grid - Solar water heating systems
6. Разработка онлайн-калькулятора для различных технологий малых возобновляемых источников энергии для использования всеми заинтересованными сторонами, включая домохозяек. 1. Developed online module (calculator) for the potential of using solar collectors and PV panels, the calculator is aimed at popularization of RES among the population, farmers and SMEs; - The online calculator is an easy-to-integrate API application that includes the ability to install on third-party websites (backward compatibility, logicality, consistency) - The online calculator includes 2 technologies: calculation for solar PV panels and solar collectors, taking into account data verification in accordance with licensed software for calculating the effectiveness of technologies
7. For testing financial instruments to stimulate development of small-scale renewable energy projects, an agreement with the financial partner of the Project, DAMU Fund JSC was signed, the following rules and forms were agreed and approved: - Rules for the provision of financial support measures, which include conditions, limits, rates, monitoring of implementation, etc. - Forms of a subsidy agreement, which regulate the conditions for the payment of subsidies to businesses, the requirements to partner financial organizations, etc. Together with Damu Fund JSC, premier green bonds was successfully issued at the AIX stock exchange in the AIFC (Astana International Financial Centre), which proved the markets readiness to finance renewable energy projects, and to raise a potential of DAMU in attracting targeted green funds for renewable energy projects. A catalog of technologies, criteria for small scale renewable energy projects selections were developed, the limits and conditions of the program have been determined for the re-using by Damu and other market participants of the green funding process (consultants, intermediaries, businesses and financial institutions).
